comments:
On Windows XP --
1) Create test (any type)
2) Launch test through launch configuration.  On "Test Logs" tab, enter the name "test" and be sure override checkbox is left unchecked.

3) Once test completes (creating file test.execution), launch again, this time naming test log "TEST"
4) TEST.execution will not be created.  Exception at bottom of this description is thrown.  (Resource of a different case already exists)

Although this is another one of those defects which ultimately depends on the Eclipse workbench's decision to not be case-insensitive even if the OS is case-insensitive.  There's a number of defects already open about that, which aren't likely to be fixed, due to the performance impact.  However, when an test log of the same name is created (with the override flag turned off), a timestamp is appended to the new file name.  We'd like this same behavior to occur when files can't be created.

Thus, when following the steps above, two files would exist at the end:

file.execution
FILE_123456789.execution
